thread.title: James J. Kane Sr., 84, bank executive and family man
thread.title_full: James J. Kane Sr., 84, bank executive and family man

author: Bonnie L. Cook
title: James J. Kane Sr., 84, bank executive and family man

organizations.name: committee to benefit the children in the oncology department

text:
James J. Kane Sr., 84, bank executive and family man Updated: February 17, 2017 — 4:32 PM EST Share 

’s Pocket -- jumping off the South Street Bridge, swimming in the Schuylkill, sneaking into the Palestra for basketball games, and parking cars for the Eagles players at Franklin Field, when the team was based there. 

Mr. Kane immediately became involved in the Springfield community, volunteering as a baseball and basketball coach, and serving as president of the Springfield Boys/Youth Club, and the Springfield High School Football Booster organization. 
He was devoted to his children and rarely missed their school or sports events. 
“’s basketball, and was fortunate to see his beloved Wildcats win two National Championships,” his family wrote in a tribute. 
When he became grandfather to 12, he could be found at events in Springfield and later, when they grew up and moved away, throughout the country. Until just before his death, he followed their dance recitals, art shows, school functions, sacraments, graduations, and athletic events. 
“” his family wrote. “He made it clear that in life, anything less than your best effort was unacceptable, and he ensured that was instilled in his family.” 
A viewing will be held from 9 to 11 a.m., Saturday, Feb. 18, immediately followed by a Funeral Mass, both at St. Francis of Assisi Church, 136 Saxer Ave., Springfield. Interment will be at SS. Peter and Paul Cemetery, Springfield. 
Memorial contributions may be made to the Committee to Benefit the Children in the Oncology Department at St. Christophers Hospital via www.cbckids.org. February 17, 2017 — 4:32 PM EST
